Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Aeolian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior, from top: grazing goat to left (part of head, antler, neck with added purple, right foreleg, part of left foreleg, and chest remaining); dot, small cross, and cross with dotted chevrons as filling ornament; below, wide black band between narrow brown bands; below, projecting from base, frieze of long, double-outlined tongues with a short dotted spike in interstices; faded added red on tongues.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Bibliographic references: Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p. 118, 122, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.10)
